attributes.name: closable
attributes.description: Set to true to make the alert closable.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the alert is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of alert.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description: The rate of the animation's change over time.

attributes.name: end-delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

attributes.name: iteration-start
attributes.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

attributes.name: iterations
attributes.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the animation to use.

attributes.name: pause
attributes.description: Pauses the animation. The animation will resume when this prop is removed.

attributes.name: playback-rate
attributes.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Alternative text for the image.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: The image source to use for the avatar.

attributes.name: initials
attributes.description: Initials to use as a fallback when no image is available (1-2 characters max recommended).

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the avatar.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style badge with rounded edges.

attributes.name: pulse
attributes.description: Set to true to make the badge pulsate to draw attention.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The badge's type.

attributes.name: caret
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the button with a caret for use with dropdowns, popovers, etc.

attributes.name: circle
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a circle button.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the button.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is set.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the button in a loading state.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: An optional name for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style button with rounded edges.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The button's size.

attributes.name: submit
attributes.description: Indicates if activating the button should submit the form. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is set.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The button's type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: An optional value for the button. Ignored when `href` is set.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: A label to use for the button groups `aria-label` attribute.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the checkbox in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the checkbox.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the checkbox in an indeterminate state.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The checkbox's name attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The checkbox's value attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the color picker.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
The format to use for the display value. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, and HSLA
respectively. The color picker will always accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert
it to the desired format.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Set to true to render the color picker inline rather than inside a dropdown.

attributes.name: opacity
attributes.description: Whether to show the opacity slider.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: When `inline` is true, this determines the size of the color picker's trigger.

attributes.name: uppercase
attributes.description: By default, the value will be set in lowercase. Set this to true to set it in uppercase instead.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current color.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to prevent the user from toggling the details.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the details is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description: The summary to show in the details header. If you need to display HTML, use the `summary` slot instead.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The dialog's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

attributes.name: no-header
attributes.description:
Set to true to disable the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an
easy, accessible way for users to dismiss the dialog.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dialog is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: contained
attributes.description:
By default, the drawer slides out of its containing block (usually the viewport). To make the drawer slide out of
its parent element, set this prop and add `position: relative` to the parent.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The drawer's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

attributes.name: no-header
attributes.description:
Removes the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the drawer.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the drawer is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The direction from which the drawer will open.

attributes.name: close-on-select
attributes.description: Determines whether the dropdown should hide when a menu item is selected.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dropdown is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the dropdown panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the panel
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The locale to use when formatting the number.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: The unit to display.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number to format in bytes.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: An alternative description to use for accessibility. If omitted, the name or src will be used to generate it.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: An external URL of an SVG file.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the button.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: An alternative description to use for accessibility. If omitted, the name or src will be used to generate it.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw. See the icon component for a full list of icons.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: An external URL of an SVG file.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position of the divider as a percentage.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: The input's autocaptialize attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: The input's autocomplete attribute.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: The input's autocorrect attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The input's autofocus attribute.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to add a clear button when the input is populated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the input.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The input's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The input's label.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The input's max attribute.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The input's maxlength attribute.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The input's min attribute.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The input's minlength attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name attribute.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The input's pattern attribute.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style input with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The input's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Set to true for a readonly input.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: The input's required attribute.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The input's size.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The input's step attribute.

attributes.name: toggle-password
attributes.description: Set to true to add a password toggle button for password inputs.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The input's type.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input's value attribute.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the menu item in an active state.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the item in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the menu item in a disabled state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A unique value to store in the menu item.

attributes.name: percentage
attributes.description: The progress bar's percentage, 0 to 100.

attributes.name: percentage
attributes.description: The current progress percentage, 0 - 100.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the progress ring in pixels.

attributes.name: stroke-width
attributes.description: The stroke width of the progress ring in pixels.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the radio in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the radio.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The radio's name attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio's value attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the input.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The input's max attribute.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The input's min attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name attribute.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The input's step attribute.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: The preferred placedment of the tooltip.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input's value attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the rating.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The highest rating to show.

attributes.name: precision
attributes.description: The minimum increment value allowed by the control.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the rating readonly.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The current rating.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to add a clear button when the select is populated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the select control.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The select's label.

attributes.name: max-tags-visible
attributes.description:
The maximum number of tags to show when `multiple` is true. After the maximum, "+n" will be shown to indicate the
number of additional items that are selected. Set to -1 to remove the limit.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Set to true to enable multiselect.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The select's name.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style select with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The select's placeholder text.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: The select's required attribute.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The select's size.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the control. This will be a string or an array depending on `multiple`.

attributes.name: effect
attributes.description: Determines which effect the skeleton will use.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the switch in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the switch.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The switch's name attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The switch's value attribute.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the tab in an active state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the tab in a disabled state.

attributes.name: panel
attributes.description: The name of the tab panel the tab will control. The panel must be located in the same tab group.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The placement of the tabs.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: When true, the tab panel will be shown.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The tab panel's name.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to make the tag clearable.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style tag with rounded edges.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The tag's size.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The tag's type.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: The textarea's autocaptialize attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: The textarea's autocomplete attribute.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: The textarea's autocorrect attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The textarea's autofocus attribute.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the textarea.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The textarea's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The textarea's label.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The textarea's maxlength attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The textarea's name attribute.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The textarea's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Set to true for a readonly textarea.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: The textarea's required attribute.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows to display by default.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The textarea's size.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The textarea's value attribute.

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: The tooltip's content.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the tooltip so it won't show when triggered.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the tooltip is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple
options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated
programmatically.
